cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 70 mi (115 km) SE of Grand Turk Island
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking west-northwest across the Turks and Caicos and Bahamas, then forecast to turn northward toward south Florida and move up the Florida peninsula

weather_observation.watch_coast: Jupiter Inlet southward around the Florida peninsula to Bonita Beach, including the Florida Keys and adjacent waters
weather_observation.warning_coast: Dominican Republic north coast, Haiti north coast, Turks & Caicos, southeastern–central–northwestern Bahamas (Hurricane Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Turks & Caicos, Bahamas, northern Hispaniola, Cuba east, and most of the Florida coastline including the Gulf side
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds possible (45% chance) by late Sunday with a 16% chance of 50-kt winds; hurricane-force gusts possible if the track shifts west.
weather_observation.storm_surge: If Irma tracks close to the west coast of Florida, surge of 3–5 ft into Tampa Bay is possible; lower if the center remains well east.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands could bring 4–8 inches of rain to the Tampa Bay area, producing localized flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents, large waves, and a low but non-zero tornado risk in outer rainbands.
